title: So as a support main... I'm completely fine with the support item changes.
body:
I like them.  Literally the only valid complaint about them that I've seen is that they Relics don't provide a lot of tankiness.

Which tbh, is balanced by the fact the spell thiefs lost their sustain as well, but I can understand why supps like Leona or Naut could be miffed by it.

I'm REALLY glad Coin is gone.  That was the most bs supp item imho.  Though the movement speed niche was nice, the fact you got the gold for literally just existing in lane- no last hitting or hitting spells- made it a toxic item in the role.  We still have a lot of time before we can make final judgements and they haven't been out that long.  But overall the items feel satisfying to use.   They obviously still need to be fine tuned, but they work well.  Forcing champs like Sona and Janna to interact with the lane and not be overbearing due to sustain.

replies.body: I like the idea, but it completely fucks over supports later in the game. I now physically need to KS as many kills as i physically can just so i can continue to get items because i only get 600g from my support item. It cost me 400 gold, and i got 1000 from it, and its dead. I cant CS, it wont let me. I cant get any gold from it, it was removed. I physically cannot afford to let my ADC get kills if i want to enjoy the game at all.

No, you got 1609 + An entire item.  For the cost of 400.

And once you get Shard of True Ice, you can CS all you want.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2019-11-25T04:26:07.932+0000)
>
> No, you got 1609 + An entire item.  For the cost of 400.
> 
> And once you get Shard of True Ice, you can CS all you want.

No, i got  600. I paid 400g for a 1000g bonus. This only gives me minimal raw stats and wards. I need more than that to function. Hell, i physically lose the 600g bonus buying early regen/late CDR because my items no longer have them.

Supports arent ward bots anymore. I need more than just some AP/AD/HP. I need EHP for leona or other item bonus effects or to otherwise scale my spells on mage supports, typically with rylais/liandries. These have real costs i need to put into. 

And no, once you get shard you CAN NOT CS all you want. Tier 3 retains Eat The Rich. CSing with a tier 3 nets you 5gold/minion

No, you paid 400 gold for a 1600 bonus.
2400 if you count the final upgrade.

So that's 2000 gold pure profit to buy on your next item.

And no the diminishing return is not retained.  It's a part of the Tribute passive, which is removed.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=0005000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T04:40:37.210+0000)
>
> No, you paid 400 gold for a 1600 bonus.
> 2400 if you count the final upgrade.
> 
> So that's 2000 gold pure profit to buy on your next item.
> 
> And no the diminishing return is not retained.  It's a part of the Tribute passive, which is removed.

Literally not how that works. I paid 400g and only got 1000g from the item itself. Thats it. Old frostfang i paid ~800g, ended with near 2k from it AND i could CS once i got wards. So thats a LOT of gold above that that im missing out.

Now, once you hit 1000g from the item, you physically cannot generate any gold. You arent allowed to CS, and you have no goldgen minigame. You got 600g net gain, and thats it.

And yes, Eat The Rich still applies. Its not part of tribute. Its a part of the item itself, including tier 3.

You also got 1400 gold worth of stats from that 400 gold.

so 1000+1400-400, 2000 profit.

And actually, you keep generating 18 gold per minute, as that's a stat, not a passive.
 And:
https://leagueoflegends.fandom.com/wiki/Shard_of_True_Ice
You're wrong.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=000500000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T04:46:25.437+0000)
>
> You also got 1400 gold worth of stats from that 400 gold.
> 
> so 1000+1400-400, 2000 profit.
> 
> And actually, you keep generating 18 gold per minute, as that's a stat, not a passive.
>  And:
> https://leagueoflegends.fandom.com/wiki/Shard_of_True_Ice
> You're wrong.

Eat the rich isnt physically listed on any of the items, its a restriction inherent to literally all of them, including tier 3s. Unless there has been a hotfix to patch it out of tier 3s, youre physically wrong.

You're right, i was wrong, and shouldn't have trusted Wikia.

However, after testing in Practice tool, you get 30 minions per 10 minutes that you're allowed to kill for full gold with the Spell Thief Line.  While i can admit that's not a lot, supports should never naturally reach that level of CS outside of the Relic items.  Whose limit I don't know.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=00050000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T05:00:30.945+0000)
>
> You're right, i was wrong, and shouldn't have trusted Wikia.
> 
> However, after testing in Practice tool, you get 30 minions per 10 minutes that you're allowed to kill for full gold with the Spell Thief Line.  While i can admit that's not a lot, supports should never naturally reach that level of CS outside of the Relic items.  Whose limit I don't know.

Relic line is the same, so youre forced to get near that CS just to proc it. And as a mage support, you roam a lot later or cover lanes solo. And given youre physically not getting gold from the item anymore.... youre forced to get gold somehow. Which would be to CS, but youre literally not allowed to CS either. 

So your only option for gold income is to poach as many kills as possible. You cant settle for just assists.

I settle for just assists and I've been doing fine.

I've never intentionally tried to steal kills, no have I ever tried to CS as support Lux, Sona or Lulu.  I have always and still do just fine without it.

And keep in mind, Lux is mana heavy af.  Especially her main poke.  Utility items aren't super expensive, Ward gold and assists work just fine.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=0005000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T05:07:12.412+0000)
>
> I settle for just assists and I've been doing fine.
> 
> I've never intentionally tried to steal kills, no have I ever tried to CS as support Lux, Sona or Lulu.  I have always and still do just fine without it.
> 
> And keep in mind, Lux is mana heavy af.  Especially her main poke.  Utility items aren't super expensive, Ward gold and assists work just fine.

A single item is ~2k gold for a support item. You only get 1k gold from this, and thats it. Your entire budget for the entire game is 1k outside of passive generation and takedowns. Thats abyssmal.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=00050000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T05:09:55.885+0000)
>
> A single item is ~2k gold for a support item. You only get 1k gold from this, and thats it. Your entire budget for the entire game is 1k outside of passive generation and takedowns. Thats abyssmal.

Particularly if your team is behind.

> [{quoted}](name=blindasleep,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=000500000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T05:13:40.121+0000)
>
> Particularly if your team is behind.

This change is really weird for supports who are behind. If youre behind on your goldgen item now, its not as bad, as there is a hard cap. If youre behind on takedowns, even if youre ahead on your gold item, youre extremely far behind.

If im playing soraka into pyke, im by definition just behind the pyke. Im a defensive support, im healing, im likely not causing kills early outside certain lanecomps (soraka has a lot of damage, but low kill power). Pyke, however, is just going to get kills just by existing. Even if i harass him and get 1000g to his 500g, its not going to matter in 4 minutes when he is 1000g as well, oh and 5 kills up on me or more. 

Defensive supports take a really big hit here.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=0005000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T05:24:59.721+0000)
>
> This change is really weird for supports who are behind. If youre behind on your goldgen item now, its not as bad, as there is a hard cap. If youre behind on takedowns, even if youre ahead on your gold item, youre extremely far behind.
> 
> If im playing soraka into pyke, im by definition just behind the pyke. Im a defensive support, im healing, im likely not causing kills early outside certain lanecomps (soraka has a lot of damage, but low kill power). Pyke, however, is just going to get kills just by existing. Even if i harass him and get 1000g to his 500g, its not going to matter in 4 minutes when he is 1000g as well, oh and 5 kills up on me or more. 
> 
> Defensive supports take a really big hit here.

Yep, and all of the items favor ranged over melee as well now since if you think you can't risk going up to poke with the AD/AP focused items you just take the trade offs of the HP focused ones, since the execute still works, and play safe while still getting your procs off, while melee has to enter threat/poke range regardless of which they take.
I haven't played properly for a month or so, so if I could ask: How are enchanter support items now? I play supports that would normally only go Spellthief's Edge, how is it now?

You should probably take Mana Band 100% of the time.  Your poke will be stronger, but your sustain will be far worse.  
Due to the auto upgrade, you don't have to rush your first back to buy the first upgrade as soon as possible, and since you no longer need a nearby ally, you get gold at a higher rate if your ADC isn't in lane.  So it feels far more satisfying to use imo.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-11-25T02:12:42.773+0000)
>
> You should probably take Mana Band 100% of the time.  Your poke will be stronger, but your sustain will be far worse.  
> Due to the auto upgrade, you don't have to rush your first back to buy the first upgrade as soon as possible, and since you no longer need a nearby ally, you get gold at a higher rate if your ADC isn't in lane.  So it feels far more satisfying to use imo.

The issue I have with this is that it limits build flexibility at every stage including pregame runes, unless you take overly weighted risk. The early gold is accelerated, which I honestly think could be abused by carries who can just sell it later like they do doran's items now, but on an actual support gets punished extra hard for your team falling behind unless the game drags really long, which Riot actively makes changes to prevent. So if you want a full build, or even just an average build for the last few seasons you will have to do things that will piss off your team. This will be especially problematic with players that refuse to recognize when you taking kills/farm is beneficial.
What about people saying it's a huge cut from income?

> [{quoted}](name=Enchantrous,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T02:15:28.068+0000)
>
> What about people saying it's a huge cut from income?

It's that if your team falls behind, you fall even further behind, and get actively punished if you have to adjust and hard farm to help your team.

I... haven't noticed that at all.  If you're keeping up on warding and assists you really shouldn't be any less off on gold than before.

In fact, gold generates much faster now if anything, it's just that the items actually fall off late in gold gen.  Basically assuming you're poking properly you will get your first 2 items WAY sooner, since the pre season started I regularly go my first back with 1000+ gold, which is amazingly satisfying.  As long as you're playing your role properly, I don't think you should notice a difference in overall gold amounts.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T02:19:11.210+0000)
>
> I... haven't noticed that at all.  If you're keeping up on warding and assists you really shouldn't be any less off on gold than before.
> 
> In fact, gold generates much faster now if anything, it's just that the items actually fall off late in gold gen.  Basically assuming you're poking properly you will get your first 2 items WAY sooner, since the pre season started I regularly go my first back with 1000+ gold, which is amazingly satisfying.  As long as you're playing your role properly, I don't think you should notice a difference in overall gold amounts.

Friend you play carries with utility as supports which honestly work better with these items than champions that are supports by design. Which was a big part of the problem with the old items anyway.

Lux is a support by design.  She always has been.  

People just don't like her.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T04:11:12.103+0000)
>
> Lux is a support by design.  She always has been.  
> 
> People just don't like her.

She was a mid by design. That's why her scaling is so high. She got nerfed down because people kept playing her as support, just like Annie, Brand and Zyra. Her ult is a long range cannon that meant if you went even with her in a trade or she long range poked you down first and you ran away she would still get the kill by outplaying burstier champs who didn't out right kill her. She got pushed out of mid by assassins  and mobility creep making her poke harder to land, while being in a duo lane meant that her poke became zone control putting opponents into a pick who's damage to take and lose anyway since the other option was an ADC or don't farm.

I can link you her spotlight right now.

She was designed to be a supportive Morgana and was always intended to be in a duo lane.  NOT mid lane.  She was NEVER supposed to be in the mid lane.  Her kit is MEANT for zoning, and snaring multiple targets, it's also why she has an aoe shield.

Her ult was meant to pick up kills her team missed, so they'd at least get assists.  She got pushed mid, by a bunch of people who refused to play her support.  Not the other way around.  And furthermore, support has always been her more popular role, even before Assassins started shoving the likes of Brand and Vel'Koz out.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=00010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T04:43:07.350+0000)
>
> I can link you her spotlight right now.
> 
> She was designed to be a supportive Morgana and was always intended to be in a duo lane.  NOT mid lane.  She was NEVER supposed to be in the mid lane.  Her kit is MEANT for zoning, and snaring multiple targets, it's also why she has an aoe shield.
> 
> Her ult was meant to pick up kills her team missed, so they'd at least get assists.  She got pushed mid, by a bunch of people who refused to play her support.  Not the other way around.  And furthermore, support has always been her more popular role, even before Assassins started shoving the likes of Brand and Vel'Koz out.

Watched the spotlight designed caster/support literally shows her being used solo as much as with help and tells you she is intended to be built carry, but is designed to be able to build supporty if behind as a fallback strat. Meaning first she was pushed to just mid because she wouldn't be allowed to farm and her kit was built around doing damage and scaling, it's the reason she can proc her own passive where as she taught Riot that was a bad Idea for supports so Leona can't do the same, and got pushed out of mid for the reasons stated earlier. So sure I was mistaken, she was meant for both and that's why her kit is so problematic. Doesn't invalidate what I said completely, because she was designed before Riot went through their everything should really only have one viable role phase, why you have to do some interesting things to play Leona/Janna/Sona as anything but support. Pika Fox is right, the support role wasn't a thing when she was released, that was something that happen because players realized that high utility champs could be impactful with less gold and that meant that the dou partner could go full carry without fighting each other over cs. It's a product of high level play.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=00010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T04:43:07.350+0000)
>
> I can link you her spotlight right now.
> 
> She was designed to be a supportive Morgana and was always intended to be in a duo lane.  NOT mid lane.  She was NEVER supposed to be in the mid lane.  Her kit is MEANT for zoning, and snaring multiple targets, it's also why she has an aoe shield.
> 
> Her ult was meant to pick up kills her team missed, so they'd at least get assists.  She got pushed mid, by a bunch of people who refused to play her support.  Not the other way around.  And furthermore, support has always been her more popular role, even before Assassins started shoving the likes of Brand and Vel'Koz out.

She was meant to be mid primary. Hell, she was more commonly an ADC with AD before she was a support upon release.

No, this is literally pure bs.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pJB6JWDESWU

She was designed, as a supportive Morgana, and always intended for a Duo Lane, as stated by Riot, as stated by her primary classification as a support, as shown by her listing in the support category of Riot discussion videos, as shown when she represented the supports THIS YEAR in the mid season play offs!

Lux is made to support, and no matter how much you dislike it or downvote it, that will _never_ have not been the case.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=0001000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-25T04:48:52.796+0000)
>
> No, this is literally pure bs.
> 
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pJB6JWDESWU
> 
> She was designed, as a supportive Morgana, and always intended for a Duo Lane, as stated by Riot, as stated by her primary classification as a support, as shown by her listing in the support category of Riot discussion videos, as shown when she represented the supports THIS YEAR in the mid season play offs!
> 
> Lux is made to support, and no matter how much you dislike it or downvote it, that will _never_ have not been the case.

Morgana at the time was a midlaner. Support here does not mean support role, it means mid laner with utility. Again, she was more often played ADC, even by her designer, than she was played support at the time. With AD items. Over support.

She was literally _DESIGNED_ for a DUO LANE.  Not mid, which was a solo lane.

She was never intended for a solo lane.
The massive decrease in gold income is not mathematically debatable. <------ That is a period.

Hold on fucked something up.

?
Well Let's see, previously Spell Thief granted 11 gold per stack consumed and +2 gold per second.
New version grants 15 gold per stack consumed and +2 gold per 10 seconds.
Stacks charge at the same rate.  Old spell thief required a near by ally.

So, with new spell thief, your gold rate increases from 78 gold/minute to 102 gold/minute.

So first phase your gold income has largely increased.


Old frost fang was the same but granted 22 gold per stack consumed, so you got 144 gold/minute.
New one grants +3 gold per second but keeps to 15 gold per stack.  108 gold/minute.

Oh and also, you're getting 450 gold for free since you get the update for free, so let's divide that per minute of optimal play.
That adds 97 gold to it.  For a total of 205 gold/minute.

Huh, gold gain still didn't _actually_ decrease.  But... by the time you get the third item, it should fall off, which it does.  You go from 144 gold/minute to 18 gold/minute, BUT also a free immediate 800 value item and you can cs again.

The fact of the matter, played optimally, it is a buff to Support's laning phase gold.

This isn't mathematically debatable.

It does however, punish bad supports.  Which is a _good thing_.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qFjOdkts,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2019-11-25T04:26:58.247+0000)
>
> Hold on fucked something up.
> 
> ?
> Well Let's see, previously Spell Thief granted 11 gold per stack consumed and +2 gold per second.
> New version grants 15 gold per stack consumed and +2 gold per 10 seconds.
> Stacks charge at the same rate.  Old spell thief required a near by ally.
> 
> So, with new spell thief, your gold rate increases from 78 gold/minute to 102 gold/minute.
> 
> So first phase your gold income has largely increased.
> 
> 
> Old frost fang was the same but granted 22 gold per stack consumed, so you got 144 gold/minute.
> New one grants +3 gold per second but keeps to 15 gold per stack.  108 gold/minute.
> 
> Oh and also, you're getting 450 gold for free since you get the update for free, so let's divide that per minute of optimal play.
> That adds 97 gold to it.  For a total of 205 gold/minute.
> 
> Huh, gold gain still didn't _actually_ decrease.  But... by the time you get the third item, it should fall off, which it does.  You go from 144 gold/minute to 18 gold/minute, BUT also a free immediate 800 value item and you can cs again.
> 
> The fact of the matter, played optimally, it is a buff to Support's laning phase gold.
> 
> This isn't mathematically debatable.

It is easily debatable; tier 1 items are strictly worse, as you lost damage/regen. Just from a numbers perspective you dont even gain 400g worth of stats from them.

Tier 2s are also worse, as you lost damage/regen/cdr. Yes, it didnt cost me gold to upgrade, but it doesnt come with anything that i physically need specifically for lane. It also comes later, as it costs 500g to trigger upgrade, where as before it cost less to buy the upgrade.

You lose all your lane specific stats in these items in the laning phase. I need the regen/healing more than i need a small amount of AP/HP.

The loss of any form of sustain and the loss of the entirety of the tribute passive after it gets fully upgraded is a huge issue with me. Is it that broken to still have those passives on the fully completed items? Specially when getting the fully stacked items can take forever? Why does it matter if you can get another 1k gold in another 20 mins? How about the mana/health regen? Is it too much to ask for even 50% regen to be on the items? These items feel horrible to use.

I don't care that I don't have to spend money upgrading them, the money I am saving upgrading them is spent pretty much on trying to get back what they don't give anymore and then if you somehow manage to get full build you are left with a very underwhelming and pointless item whose only goal is to provide wards. I rather get a dedicated ward slot so I don't have this borderline useless item on my inventory.
I really like the changes. Instead of having to rush ward item you can focus on building other items.

I don't mind the change too much?  I do miss coin for matchups that I can't poke without feeding.

I take about as much CS as I did before and it doesn't seem to make a difference.
